  <div id="container">
    <div class="docs markdown"><p>https://github.com/vallezw/sonner/assets/50796600/59b95cb7-9068-4f3e-8469-0b35d9de5cf0</p>
<p><a href="https://sonner.emilkowal.ski/">Sonner</a> is an opinionated toast component for React. You can read more about why and how it was built <a href="https://emilkowal.ski/ui/building-a-toast-component">here</a>.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="usage">
  <h2>
    <a href="#usage" name="usage" class="pilcrow"></a>
Usage
  </h2>
</div>
<p>To start using the library, install it in your project:</p>
<pre><code class="bash">npm install sonner
</code></pre>
<p>Add <code>&lt;Toaster /&gt;</code> to your app, it will be the place where all your toasts will be rendered.
After that you can use <code>toast()</code> from anywhere in your app.</p>
<pre><code class="jsx"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> { Toaster, toast } <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'sonner'</span>;

<span class="hljs-comment">// ...</span>

<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">App</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>) </span>{
  <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> (
    <span class="xml"><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">div</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">Toaster</span> /&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">button</span> <span class="hljs-attr">onClick</span>=<span class="hljs-string">{()</span> =&gt;</span> toast('My first toast')}&gt;Give me a toast<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">button</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">div</span>&gt;</span></span>
  );
}
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="documentation">
  <h2>
    <a href="#documentation" name="documentation" class="pilcrow"></a>
Documentation
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Find the full API reference in the <a href="https://sonner.emilkowal.ski/getting-started">documentation</a>.</p>
</div>
  </div>
